Seram! 5 Mitos Buah-buahan Ini Bikin Merinding
04 Nov 2019, 10:42 by Sonia Basoni - detikFood



Jakarta - Buah-buahan dikenal enak dan kaya nutrisi. Tetapi ada beberapa buah yang dipercaya punya mitos menyeramkan.Sama seperti makanan lainnya, buah-buahan sudah ada sejak dulu. Banyak kisah dibalik asal usul buah-buahan di setiap negara, biasanya berupa mitos seram. Mitosnya ini meliputi banyak hal, seperti buah kelapa yang dikabarkan tumbuh dari kepala yang dipenggal.Kemudian ada buah mulberry di mana cairan merahnya memiliki mitos yang berasal dari darah. Lalu ada buah mangga yang berhubungan dengan mitos penuh racun, dan menawarkan kehidupan yang abadi.Dilansir dari List Verse (04/11), berikut lima buah yang memiliki mitos menyeramkan dan bikin merinding.Baca Juga: 5 Mitos Tentang Fast Food yang Masih Banyak Dipercaya Orang (sob/odi)


Foto: Istimewa

Buah nanas punya rasa yang segar, tapi dibalik tampilannya dan rasa yang menarik ini ada mitos tentang asal usul terciptanya buah nanas. Dulu ada seorang gadis kecil yang cantik namun pemalas bernama Pina. Menurut mitos tersebut, Pina sangat pemalas dan egosi, ia selalu mementing dirinya sendiri dan tak mau membantu orang lain.Jika keluarga atau ibunya meminta tolong untuk membantu membereskan rumah, ia akan menjawab tak bisa menemukan sapu. Suatu hari sang ibu dan kakaknya jatuh sakit, tapi Pina tetap memaksa mereka untuk membuatkannya sarapan, kemudian mengejek ibu dan kakaknya sebagai orang yang pemalas.Puncaknya ketika sang ibu meminta Pina untuk memasak nasi. Pina mengaku tak bisa menemukan beras, karena kesal sang ibu pun berharap bahwa Pina bisa memiliki seribu mata sehingga ia bisa menemukan setiap barang yang dicarinya. Setelah itu Pina tiba-tiba menghilang, dan beberapa bulan kemudian ibunya melihat ada buah berbentuk aneh, dan ketika ia mengupas kulitnya, buah itu memiliki seribu mata.Dari sana ia sadar bahwa Pina telah berubah menjadi buah yang memiliki mata seribu, dan semua doanya terkabul. Hingga akhirnya lahirlah buah bernama nanas.

(sob/odi)



Foto: Istimewa

Mangga jadi salah satu buah kekinian, yang paling sering dijadikan topping minuman. Ternyata buah mangga punya hubungan dengan burung jenis magpie. Burung magpie diketahui sudah ada sejak jaman dulu, dan menurut mitos kepercayaan sebagian orang, dulu burung magpie terbang ke surga untuk membawa biji mangga kepada seorang raja.Ketika buah mangga sudah tumbuh, raja itu pun menyuruh seorang pria tua untuk menyantap buah mangga pertama. Tapi ternyata, buah mangga itu sudah diracuni oleh bisa dari ular yang ada di pohon mangga itu. Pria tua itu pun meninggal di tempat.Terkejut dengan hal ini, raja pun membunuh burung magpie tersebut. Kemudian, ada seorang wanita yang memakan buah mangga, dan membuktikan bahwa mangga itu tak beracun dan justru membuatnya muda kembali. Hingga muncul lah buah mangga, yang diambil dari kata magpie.

(sob/odi)



Foto: Istimewa

Menurut legenda dan mitos yang ada, buah mulberry awalnya memiliki warna putih, namun warnanya berubah menjadi merah setelah terkena darah. Darah ini berasal dari kisah cinta tragis Pyramus dan Thisbe, antara pasangan yang dilarang menikah oleh orang tua mereka.Setelah mereka melakukan hubungan terlarang, mereka memutuskan untuk bertemu di pohon mulberry. Saat itu Thisbee melihat ada singa yang ditutupi oleh darah segar tak jauh dari sana. Sang kekasih, Pyramus melihat wajah singa yang berdarah, dan dia berasumsi bahwa kekasihnya sudah dimakan singa. Akhirnya Pyramusmembunuh dirinya sendiri.Melihat Pyramus yang sudah tak bernyawa, Thisbepun ikut bunuh diri. Sebelum ia meninggal, Thisbemelihat buah mulberry itu berubah menjadi merah. Warna merah ini dilambangkan sebagai darah, yang terjadi pada kisah cinta Pyramus dan Thisbe yang tragis.

(sob/odi)



Foto: Istimewa

Banyak mitos yang berhubungan kelapa, salah satunya mitos di mana kelapa itu tumbuh dari kepala manusia yang terpenggal. Buah kelapa yang memiliki ukuran seperti kepala manusia, membuat banyak orang percaya dengan mitos yang satu ini.Dulu di Inggris, buah kelapa dipercaya tumbuh dari kepala seorang anak kecil laki-laki yang kepalanya putus, karena digigit oleh ikan hiu. Kepalanya akhirnya dikubur di dekat panta, dan tak lama setelah itu muncul pohon kelapa pertama.Sementara itu menurut mitos dari Arapesh, kelapa itu sebenarnya berasal dari kepala seorang pria yang membunuh wanita yang tengah jalan bersama sang suami. Kemudian pria ini pun dibunuh, dan kepalanya dipenggal oleh anak-anak dari wanita itu. Sementara di Burma, mitos buah kelapa berasal dari kepala seorang pria yang dipenggal oleh raja di New Guinea, yang sudah kesal dengan perilaku pria itu.

(sob/odi)



Foto: Istimewa

Strawberry dipercaya sebagai buah yang melambangkan kesucian. Sayangnya, ada seorang dewi bernama Norse Goddess Friga yang cemburu dengan predikat yang diraih oleh buah strawberry, sehingga ia membuat peraturan ketat, di mana setiap orang yang mendekat ke surga, dengan jejak strawberry di tubuhnya akan segera di tolak.Tak hanya itu, mitos lain juga berkembang seputar buah strawberry dengan kaitannya sebagai lambang kesucian. Ada mitos yang menyebutkan bahwa ketika bayi meninggal, arwah mereka akan pergi ke surga, namun untuk menghindari kegelapan yang menjemput, mereka akan menyamar sebagai strawberry.Sehingga dari mitos ini muncul kesimpulan bahwa siapapun yang menyantap buah strawberry, berarti mereka juga memakan bayi-bayi kecil. Scary! 5 Myths These Fruits Make Goosebumps
Nov 04 2019, 10:42 by Sonia Basoni - detikFood



Jakarta - Fruits are known to be delicious and rich in nutrition. But there are some fruits that are believed to have creepy myths. Just like other foods, fruits have been around for a long time. Many stories behind the origin of fruits in each country, usually in the form of spooky myths. These myths include many things, such as coconuts that are rumored to grow from decapitated heads. Then there are mulberries where the red liquid has a myth that comes from blood. Then there are mangoes that are associated with myths full of poison, and offer eternal life. Reported from List Verse (04/11), here are five fruits that have creepy and creepy myths. Also Read: 5 Myths About Fast Food that is Still Much Trusted People (friend / odi)


Photo: Special

Pineapple has a fresh taste, but behind its appearance and interesting taste there is a myth about the origin of the creation of pineapple. There used to be a beautiful but lazy little girl named Pina. According to this myth, Pina is very lazy and selfish, she is always selfish and does not want to help others. If her family or mother asks for help to clean up the house, she will answer that she can't find a broom. One day the mother and her sister fell ill, but Pina still forced them to make her breakfast, then mocked her mother and sister as lazy people. The peak was when the mother asked Pina to cook rice. Pina claimed that she could not find rice, because she was upset that she hoped that Pina could have a thousand eyes so that she could find every item she was looking for. After that Pina suddenly disappeared, and a few months later his mother saw a strange-shaped fruit, and when he peeled off his skin, the fruit had a thousand eyes. From there he realized that Pina had turned into a fruit that had a thousand eyes, and all his prayers were answered . Until finally born a fruit called pineapple.

(friend / odi)



Photo: Special

Mango is one of the most recent fruits, most often used as a beverage topping. It turns out that the mango has a relationship with magpie birds. Magpies are known to have existed since ancient times, and according to some people's belief myths, magpies first flew to heaven to bring mango seeds to a king. When a mango grows, the king tells an old man to eat the first mango. But it turns out, the mango was poisoned by snake venom in the mango tree. The old man died on the spot. Shocked by this, the king killed the magpie bird. Then, there was a woman who ate a mango, and proved that the mango was not poisonous and instead made her young again. Until the mango fruit appears, which is taken from the word magpie.

(friend / odi)



Photo: Special

According to legend and myth, mulberries initially had a white color, but the color turned red after being exposed to blood. This blood comes from the tragic love story of Pyramus and Thisbe, between couples who are forbidden to marry by their parents. After they have forbidden relations, they decide to meet on the mulberry tree. At that moment Thisbee saw a lion covered in fresh blood not far from there. The lover, Pyramus saw the face of a bleeding lion, and he assumed that his lover had been eaten by a lion. Finally Pyramus killed himself. Seeing Pyramus, who was already lifeless, Thisbepun also committed suicide. Before he died, This saw the mulberry fruit turn red. This red color is symbolized as blood, which occurs in the tragic love story of Pyramus and Thisbe.

(friend / odi)



Photo: Special

Many myths related to coconuts, one of which is the myth where the coconut grew from a severed human head. Coconut fruit that has a size like a human head, makes many people believe in this one myth. Previously in England, coconut fruit is believed to grow from the head of a small boy whose head was broken, because it was bitten by a shark. His head was finally buried near the panta, and shortly after that the first coconut tree appeared. Meanwhile, according to the myth of Arapesh, the coconut actually came from the head of a man who killed a woman who was walking with her husband. Then this man was killed, and his head was beheaded by the children of the woman. While in Burma, the myth of the coconut comes from the head of a man who was decapitated by a king in New Guinea, who was upset with his behavior.

(friend / odi)



Photo: Special

Strawberry is believed to be a fruit that symbolizes purity. Unfortunately, there was a goddess named Norse Goddess Friga who was jealous of the title achieved by strawberry fruit, so she made strict rules, where everyone who approached heaven, with traces of strawberries on his body would soon be rejected. Not only that, another myth also developed around strawberry fruit with its relation as a symbol of purity. There is a myth that says that when babies die, their spirits will go to heaven, but to avoid the darkness that fetches, they will disguise themselves as strawberries. So from this myth comes the conclusion that anyone who eats strawberries, means they also eat small babies . Hi ..! Also Read: Popular As A Breakfast Menu, 5 Myths About Eggs Are Still Trusted
